text: Siraiki also called Ubheji, Siroli, Sireli is a dialect of Sindhi language. Spoken by some Sindhi people of Sindh. Siraiki word is derived from two Sindhi words one "Siro/Sero" meaning name for region (Sauvira) in ancient Sindh, and "Ki" meaning of/Belonging to. other names also have the same meaning. The people of Siro region are called Sirai/Serai. == References == Category:Languages of Sindh
title: Siraiki (Sindhi dialect)
